Florida: ^What are you even supposed to do? A giant infectious storm, really?
^You should probably leave, for starters. Yeah, that sounds like a good plan.
^You could find some stuff to bring in your car, too. You don't have much time, by the sound of it - maybe a few hours?
^Food is important, but so is water. Fuel, too. You're pretty sure your landlord has some spare gas hidden somewhere in case the power ever goes out.
^Gas will probably be hard to come by. -1 hour

c-0: ^You scramble around your apartment, grabbing as many containers you can to fill with water.
^You probably have enough time to grab something else... but what?
^Gas will probably be hard to come by. -1 hour
c-1: ^You dig through every cupboard in your apartment, fishing for as much food as you can find.
^You probably have enough time to grab something else... but what?
^Gas will probably be hard to come by. -1 hour
c-2: ^You sneak downstairs, finding the door to the storage room already open. Most of the supplies have already been cleared out, but you find a full jerrycan left.
^You probably have enough time to grab something else... but what?

Missouri: ^It's hard to believe the news is real... a giant, infectious storm? That sounds like the plot to some horrible movie.

g-0: ^You look around, gathering your bearings and trying to decide the best course of action. You weren't able to grab much from home...
^When's the last time I got gas?
g-1: ^Maybe you could collect supplies from around here? It's not like anyone is around to use it anymore.
^Yeah, that's a good idea. But what to look for first? There's only so many hours in the day...
g-4: ^You walk forward more, noticing a lone mechanic waiting outside what appears to be an abandoned garage.
^"What are you still doing here? They sent out the evacuation notice hours ago."
^"The same could be said about you, y'know."
g-5: ^"Fair enough. What's the problem, anyway? You don't seem to rushed to get out of here."
^"I just find this all hard to believe. A mutant storm full of spores?"
^"I was on my way out now, just had to get my some things in order before I leave my life behind."

c-9: ^"I wouldn't be too sure about that. I've seen some of the people they've been wheeling across the street, and it looks pretty bad."
^"Rashes and blisters all over their face, some of them throwing up everywhere too."
c-10: ^"I get it. I've heard it's pretty bad though - seen people around with blisters and rashes all over. Looks... painful."

g-6: ^"God, that's awful. Maybe the news was right for once. But, if you saw it all, why aren't you leaving?"

c-11: ^"Can't, the government shut down the buses. I got left here to tough it out."
^"It wouldn't feel right leaving you stranded, can I offer a ride?"
^"Probably a good idea... I better head out early while I can. Good luck out there."

c-0: ^"Are you sure? I wouldn't want to be a burden. I've handled a lot in my life, some mushrooms shouldn't be too hard to deal with."
^"No, please, I insist. No decent human could leave someone else here stranded."
^"Then I accept. My name's Jane, by the way - figured you might want to know before you let me in your car."
^"Pleasure to meet you Jane. It looks like we've got a long road ahead of us."

c-1: ^"Yeah, I get it. No sense in both of us waiting around for something we can't stop."
^"I'll keep that in mind. Stay safe."

c-0: ^"You too, kid. Drive safe out there."
^As you turn around to head back to the car, you think to yourself. Maybe this is bigger than you thought?

Mississippi: ^I think I see a gas station up there, might be nice to stop for a few more things.
^As you approach the station, it's nearly deserted. Aside from the clerk inside, and a mother and daughter waiting at the door.
^"Excuse me, is this place even open?"

g-0: ^"He's closing the place down now. This whole street has basically been abandoned."
g-1: ^"Are you on your way out of town?"
^"Yes ma'am, packed up some supplies and hit the road."
g-2: ^"You seem like a responsible person, may I ask you somehting?"
g-3: ^"My daughter Sasha here, Sasha say hi"
^Sasha peaks out from hiding behind her mom and waves timidly.
^"Unfortuantly I can't take her to the bunker."
^"I'm.. how do I say this... not on great terms with the law and may not be the best idea for my to show up there."
^"Listen, you seem like a nice person but I'm not in a great place to take care of a child across the country."
^"I see, well I can offer her a spot in my car if you would trust that."

c-5: ^"I understand, maybe there will be someone else that comes along. Thank you for your time sir."
^You turn to walk into the gas station, just as the clerk is locking the doors.
^Well, guess this is a sign to hit the road.
^This is such a strange time, you never really know you can trust.
c-6: ^"Oh goodness, you have no idea what a savior you are."
^"Sasha sweetie, this nice person is going to take you to saftey ok?"
^"Bu-but mom... I don't want to leave you.."
^"I know love, but I will be there to save you soon ok?"
^"Take that space book of your's and read that on your way."
^You watch as she hugs her daughter tightly. Sasha walks over to you with a backpack full of books, she looks slightly dazed.
^ "Hi Sasha, we are gonna go on a road trip ok!"

g-4: ^"I see you're a big fan of astronauts, do you have any fun facts?"

c-7: ^You know you're not great with kids, but you couldn't imagine leaving her here in these conditions.
^You open the car door for her and you both continue on the drive.

Illinois: ^Never thought I would actually step foot in Illinois, but here we are. There's always a first for everything.
^"Excuse me, mister, do you know where I could find the closest gas station?"
^"Please sir, I'm just looking for some supplies to help on my drive. I've come from Florida and I'm only about halfway to the bunker."

c-0: ^"Hrmph. I've seen plenty of punks like you coming by here causing all sorts of trouble. *cough cough* Be on your way now."
g-0: ^"Bunker?! Don't tell me you believe in all this alien nonsense. *cough cough*"
^"I've seen plenty of these so-called viruses come and go. Haven't gotten me yet, so why should I leave?"
^"Based on what I've seen myself, I wouldn't be too sure of that. This virus is messing people up bad."
^"Listen, I don't blame you. I don't know how much of this I believe either, but they're closing down the state lines. Everyone has to leave."

c-3: ^"Not me. I'm staying right here with the r- *cough* ... excuse me ... the rest of my farm."

conversation_continue: ^"I hear ya, man. But anyway, do you know of any gas stations around here?"

g-0: ^"Not any open within at least an hour. I'll tell ya what though — since I believe we see eye to eye about most things..."
^"How about you f.. *cough*...follow me up the way to my cabin? I'll let you leave with a few things."
^"That's awfully generous, but I should really get going. Can't get caught in any more traffic."
^"If you don't mind, that would be great."

c-1: ^"I know that feeling. Well, feel free to look around the street here. People leave things around all the time."
^"Thank you sir. Are you sure you don't want to hitch a ride to the bunker? I've got more room in the back."
^"Stay safe out there. I hope the storm doesn't cause too much harm to your farm."

c-0: ^"So the roads really are that bad? I guess it can't be that bad of an idea... *cough cough* I guess I'll hitch a ride. Thanks, man."

c-2: ^"I figured my supplies aren't doing anyone justice just sitting around here doing nothing."
^You guys get to talking and as you get to talking, you learn about his love for his farm.
^Before you realize, 4 hours have already passed!
^You thank Peter for his time and rush back to your car at the end of the road.
^"As much as a pain you young folk are, I wish you the best of luck out there."
^"I wouldn't want to be out on those roads, but more importantly, I can't leave my crops here alone."

Nebraska: ^"Holy shit this place is like a ghost town."
^As you approach the closed corner market, you notice a man sitting on the bench all alone.
^You roll your window down as you approach.
^"Excuse me sir, are you ok out there?"

g-0: ^"No.. over here to your right.. the only car on the road.."
^"Hey dipship, I'm in the car right next to you."
g-1: ^"Oh, I apologize. I'm a little loopy from being out here in the cold."
^"It's ok, what are you doing out here anyway?"
g-2: ^"I was supposed to catch a flight to Idaho to see my family, but of course all the airports shut down so now I'm stuck in who knows where."
^"Ouch thats tough, can't imagine being stuck out here in this weather."
^"I'm so sorry, when is the last time you saw them?"

c-4: ^"I bet the heat in your car feels pretty nice right about now.
c-5: ^"It's been 4 months. I was on an international work trip when my layover got cancelled. Hmm, just my luck."

g-4: ^"Sorry, I don't mean to dump all this on you."
^"It's all good, I can imagine you're stressed."
g-5: ^"Hey man, I hate to ask this but... do you think I could hitch a ride to Idaho. I have no other option man im desperate."
^hmm, if I pick this man up I have to drop him off in Idaho. Is it too far out of my way?
^"I don't know if I have any more room in my car man, I'm sorry."
^"Of course you can! No man could leave someone stranded out here in this condition."

c-8: ^"No worries man, I totally get it. I am a stranger after all."
^"By the way, there's an abandoned grocery store up here on the corner, I would check it out if you're looking for supplies."
^"Thanks man. I should be off now but, stay safe out there!"
c-9: ^"Oh man, you have no idea how much of a blessing this is. I don't have much to offer, but I have some food for us to share."
^"Anything you have would be of help, thank you."
^"I think it's best if we keep driving for now."

c-0: ^"By the way, there's an empty grocery store up here on the corner. If we want to stop there I can see what they left behind."
^"What would you like me to get?"

c-1: ^"Probably a good idea. Well let's hit the road, we have a long drive ahead of us!"

N1: ^You slowly drive away from Matt on the corner. You see him look longingly at your car from the rear view mirror.
^Stop for supplies at the grocery store.

c-1: ^I've still got quite a bit to go, let's hit the road.

NorthDakota: ^Wow, this place kinda reminds me of my old campus. What a small world we live in.
^You notice an... odd.. looking man running around the grassy field infront of what appears to be the science building.
^"HEY! YOU THERE! Stay back, and I mean it, don't come ANY closer to me."
^This gut is a nut job I can already tell.
^"Woah woah, I don't mean any harm. I just stumbled across this campus on my drive to the bunker."

c-0: ^"Bunker you say, where.. the government is. Fascinating... very very fascinating..."

ND2: ^"I have a secret to tell you, but you can't tell ANYONE. Not even anyone on that little phone of yours. YOU SWEAR?"
^"Alright man I swear I swear, whatever you say is safe with me."
^"You're insane, I don't even know you."
ND3: ^"My name is Dr. Shaun Thompson, Ph. D in biotechnology. And today, November 6th, 1995 marks the date I found the cure for the radioactive sporestorm that is threatening North America.
^A cure? That sounds a little too good ot be true don't you think?"

c-0: ^"Not quite yet my friend, there is still much to discuss."
c-1: ^"Do you doubt Dr. Thompson?? That's absurd. My spore neautrilizer is by far the most advanced creation the governmetn could ever witness."

ND4: ^"If only I could make it back to Washington with this news, I could be the greatest hero of the 20th century."

g-0: ^"Well yes, that is where head government bunker is correct? I've been working so hard in my office I didn't even think of how I will get there."
^"Well, I'm on my way there now. Is it something I can take with me?"
^"If you promise you won't zap me with any of your fancy trinkets, I could let you join me on my drive."

c-1: ^"OH HEAVENS NO. Tools like these cannot be delivered without a professional like me around. I must accompany you."
^"Well doc, if that's the only way then so be it, hop in."
^"I think it's probably safest if you stay here, sorry doc."
^"I understand, well, maybe with the leftover parts the physics professors left behind I could create a make shift teleporter. Tally Ho!"
^"Alright well just... be safe and uh... dont't burn anything down!"
^I should probably check that shed over there for some gasoline while I'm here.
^Time to hit the road, I don't want wanna be by this lunatic for any second longer.

DOCJOIN: ^"Well isn't this a joyous set of events. I shall join you on your journey to Washington State and we shall save the planet!"
^"Quick! Let's rummage through the old janitor shed for some extra gasoline. It won't take too long"
^Works for me, I could always benefit from some free gas."
^"It's probably best if we hit the road now, don't want to be driving too late."
^"Well Tally Ho! Let's be on our way"
^What a strange guy, but surely he's trustworthy... right?
SouthDakota: ^I thought nothing could get creepier than the last place, but I stand corrected.
^Oh and would you look at that, just when I thought thing's couldn get scarier, there's an old women on the porch there.
^"Excuse me ma'am, do you know about the evacuation."

c-0: ^"If I hear one more hippie coming in here running their mouth..."
^"That's very rude to say to someone who is just offering to help."
^"I come in peace ma'am, I promise I'm just passing through."
^"Help with what? This is God's plan all along, im exactly where he wants me to be."
^"I'm sorry, did you say.... Gods plan?"
c-1: ^"Only time I'll have any peace is when this rapture comes and takes me there."

SD1: ^"Last sunday Pastor John said that soon there would be a sign from God that proves you are exactly where you need to be."
^"And then the following week I hear about this storm spore that's causing a ruckuss. I'll tell you what this is.. it's Gods Rapture!"
^"Ma'am, I think it may be a good idea to take you somewhere safe, I don't think you're thinking clearly."
^"Ok it's official, I think you're the craziest one I've met so far."

c-0: ^"Oh I am thinking very clearly. In fact, this is probably the clearest I've ever thought in my whole life."
c-1: ^"You're laughing now, but it wont be funny still when those clouds above you part ways and God's hand is reaching out to save his children."
g-1: ^"I have spent years practicing my religion and that does not stop when the government tell's me to."
^"No one's telling you to stop, but maybe it would be a good idea to go to the bunker so you can meet other people with the same ideas."
^"I think you might be a lost cause."

c-3: ^"Like I said, only god can tell me what to do and you're not him! If god wants me to go to the bunker he would have told me by now."
^"Funny you say that, God actually just told me he wanted you to come to the bunker with me."
^ "Alright well... if that's what god want's then that's what's gonna happen."

c-0: ^"Yeah, it's true! I'm on my way to the bunker now if you'd like to join me there."
^"Well if that's what god wants, that's what is best for me. I shall join you on the rest of the journey."
^I know this was the right choice, but oh am I in for a long ride....

c-1: ^"I wish you a good life here at this doorstep, don't drive yourself too mad."

c-0: ^You rush back to your car before she can catch up. You drive off knowing that she probably won't be the craziest one you'll meet on this journey..."

c-4: ^"LOST CAUSE? I'll show you a lost cause."
^You rush back to your car before she can catch up. You drive off knowing that she probably won't be the craziest one you'll meet on this journey..."

WyomingWithSasha: ^Wow... I've never been to Yellow Stone before. It's quite beautiful actually.
^Who knew a deadly storm is what would have brought me here...
^"Hey! You There! Don't come any closer to me with that radio of yours!"
^"The frequencies are gonna tell them exactly where I am!"

g-0: ^"Well you see, the government has been playing around with this new thing called 5G, they say it's supposed to be the biggest and brightest new thing, but I don't belive it for just one minute."
^"You sure talk a lot don't you mister."
^"I can't believe I ran into another crazy."
g-1: ^"People always say I'm crazy, but I think crazy is exciting. You should've seen the fun my daughter and I had before her mom called me crazy."
^"Oh man, I'm so sorry. That must be very difficult."
^"I can see why she said that."
g-2: ^"Oh Sasha, if only I could see her one more time before this storm takes us all."
^"Wait did you say Sasha? That's such a coincidence."
g-3: ^"I'm taking care of this young girl right now her name is Sasha."
g-4: ^You point to the girl in your backseat, here eyes are just barely visible out the window when you see her face light up.
^"This can't be real! How did you manage to find my daughter! She lives with her mother in Mississippi."
^"How can you be sure that's your daughter?"
^"Mississipi you say? That's exactly where her mother left her with me."

W1: ^"I know those eyes from anywhere, she looks just like her mother."
^you watch as Sasha rushes from the car and jumps into her fathers arms.
^"Oh sasha dear how I've missed you, all these adventures I've had to go on without you!"
^"If this is true, you must come with us to the bunker with your daughter."

c-0: ^"Oh this is the happiest day of my life! I'm reunited with my sweet girl and saved by this random person with their toxic radio box."
^"I'll tell you what stranger, a good friend of mine has a private bunker in Arizona, if you can get us there I'll make sure we all get in.
^A private bunker? In arizona?? Am I really gonna trust this guy?
^"Ok well, you have to get in my so-called toxic radio box if we are going to make it to saftey."
g-0: ^You watch as Ezekial picks up Sasha and rushes her to the backseat.
^"I'm sorry to break up this special moment, but I was given special instructions by her mother to take her to saftey, I can't let her down now."

c-1: ^"I understand, I only want what's best for her. I know that's where she'll be the safest."
^"Not for me though! I must stay here where the signals can't reach me!"
^"Goodbye Sasha and random person I just met!"
^You watch as Ezekial hugs his daughter tightly before rushing back to his tent.
^What a strange world we live in, you think to yourself as you walk Sasha back to the car.

WyomingWithoutSasha: ^"Wow... I've never been to Yellow Stone before. It's quite beautiful actually."

c-0: ^"Who knew a deadly storm is what would have brought me here..."

^"A little walk through the park never hurt anyone, might be good to get some fresh air."
^"It's probably best to not stop for long."
^You take a walk through the park
^As you lose track of time... you notice the storm approaching at a steady speed.
^You turn around... which path did you take... left... or right...
c-1: ^"Maybe I can pick up some food from that vending machine over there."

c-0: ^You grab some snacks to hold you over and then tread back to your car.

Utah: ^I know travis is around here somewhere. His cabin should be right around here.
^"I've been stranded here for AGESS, I thought you forgot about me!"
^"You have no idea the journey I've been on so far."

g-0: ^"You're telling me man, driving myself crazy over here. No signal, no car, no ladies... what's a guy supposed to do!"
^"Well let's not get too comfortable, we should probably keep this drive going."
g-1: ^"Now hold on man, you just got here! Come inside we'll grab a few things. We've got so much to catch up on."
^"Alright well let's be fast, we don't wanna waste too much time."
^"I guess a little break never hurt no one, and I have been driving non-stop."
g-2: ^"That's the spirit man! I've got one last pack of brewskies we should finish before taking off."
^"Ok, one beer then we are leaving."
^No drinking for me man, we gotta stay sharp with everything going on."

c-5: ^You get to catching up with Travis... turns out a lot has happened since his frat days in college.

c-0: ^You look outside the window... the storm is nearly at your door.
^You attempt to make a run for your car.

^"Oh wow, this place bring back some memories."

c-0: ^"This is what happens when you're stranded in a cabin alone for 4 days with enough beer to kill an army."
c-1: ^"Lot's of summers spent here remember buddy?"

U1: ^"Alright man as much as I miss this place, we have got to get on the road."

c-0: ^"I've made it this far I'm not gonna stop now."

Washington: ^After sitting in traffic for hours, you finally make it to the gates.
^Wow, it really looks like an apocolypse in here.
^It's crazy to think I just drove across the whole country.
^I ran into so many strange people...
^You aproach the gate agent, he informs you to park in the field, leave anything except water, food, and medication, and make your way to the elevators.
^You take a deep breath and realize... you survived.
Idaho: ^As you approcah the bus stop, you see a teenage boy sitting on the bench smoking a cigarette.
^"Hey man, I don't know if you've heard but all the busses are shutdown. Evacuation order."
^"Oh piss off, you sound just like my mother."
^"Well I hope you don't talk to your mother like that."
^"You seem like a real joy don't you."

g-0: ^"Can't a guy catch a break and smoke in peace."
^"You really shouldn't be smoking, kill's your lungs."
^"If you want me to leave you be you can say it nicely."
g-1: ^"Alright, then why are you still here?"
^Something about this kid seem's so familiar.
^He almost acts exactly how I did at that age.
^"Ya know, I used to smoke too at your age
g-2: ^"Because I know what you're doing—pretending you don't care. I did that too."
^"Because someone cared enough to tell me to stop before I wrecked myself. Maybe you need that too."
^"Because I’d rather not watch someone who reminds me of myself get swallowed by the storm."

c-5: ^"Yeah? And look how great that turned out."
^"When everyone acts like the world's ending, someone has to pretend it’s not."
^"You gonna tell me to come with you or something?"
^"I'm telling you I don't want to leave you here alone."
^"No. I'm giving you the choice. Stay, or come with me."

c-0: ^"Fine. Whatever. I'll walk with you. Just stop giving me that… adult responsibility look."

^"…But sitting here sulking won’t do me any favors."

c-6: ^He stares down at his cigarette, almost embarrassed.
^"Look, I’m not trying to be a jerk. I just… don’t like being told what to do."
^"Trust me, I was the same way. Come on. We can talk on the way."
^"Then don’t think of it as being told what to do. Think of it as not dying in a stupid way."

c-0: ^"You’re really not gonna let this go, huh?"

c-7: ^"Well you wouldn't want two of you in one car then, HA."

^You walk away defeatedly, sometime's there is just nothing you can do.
